Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 6" [15 cm] high.
gauge: 7.5 sc and 7 rows = 4" (10 cm) with 2 strands held together.
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc. 
• When changing colors, do not cut yarn at end of rnd but carry color not in use loosely up WS of work.  
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color

BASKET
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join B.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join A. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd:  With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join B. 24 sc.
4th rnd: With B, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. 40 sc.
6th rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. 48 sc.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1.  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. 56 sc.
8th rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. 64 sc.
9th rnd: With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. 72 sc.
10th rnd:  With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only,  1 sc in each sc around. Join A. Place marker at end of rnd.
11th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join B. 
Rep last rnd, alt rnds of A and B, until work from marked rnd measures approx 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a B rnd. 
Next rnd:  With A, ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join 2 strands of C with sl st to first sc. 66 sc.  Break A and B.
Next rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
Next rnd:  Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn. 
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn.
First Petal: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 2 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 13 sc. 
Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. 11 sc. 
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 9 sc. 
5th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 5 sc. 
Fasten off. 
Second to Sixth Petals:  With RS facing, join 2 strands of C with sl st to first unworked st of last rnd of Basket. Work 1st to 5th rows as given for First Petal.

materials: COATS® Crème De La Crème®: 1 ball each 810 Tile Blue A and 984 Bluetones B
small decorative button for Blossom Bib (optional)
measurements: Bib measure 9” (22.9 cm) wide x 7” (17.8 cm) to neck
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Trim
Round 1: With right side facing, attach B at lower left corner; ch 1, sc around bib, taking care to keep work flat; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, Reverse sc to center of first tab, turn to work sc around inside neck edge to top edge of 2nd tab, ch 4 for button loop, skip 3 sc, sc in next sc, turn to complete outside edge in Reverse sc; join. Fasten off.
With sewing needle and thread, attach button to tab without chain loop.
Car
Following directions included with the French Knitter, make 18” (45.7 cm) of I-cord with B leaving an 18” (45.7 cm) tail at beginning and end. Roll ends of I-cord into wheel shapes and the remaining length in a car shape following photo. Secure to bib with yarn tails. Add backstitch detail following photo.

BIB
Ch 17.
Row 1 (Right Side): (Hdc, sc) all in 3rd ch from hook, sc in each ch to last ch; (sc, hdc) all in last ch; turn – 17 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, (hdc, sc) in first st, sc in each st to last st; (sc, hdc) all in last st; turn –19 sts.
Repeat Row 2 until there are 31 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across.
Repeat last row until 7” (17.8 cm) from beginning, end wrong side row.
Divide for Neck: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sc; TURN. 
Decrease 1 st at neck edge on next 5 rows – 7 sts. Work 6 rows even in sc, end wrong side row.
Shape Tab-Next Row: Ch 1, decrease, sc in next 4 sts, (sc, hdc) all in last st; turn – 7 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat last 2 rows twice more – 7 sts.
Decrease at each end of next 2 rows – 3 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, draw up a loop in next 3 sts, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook – 1 st. Fasten off.
With right side facing, skip center 7 sc, attach yarn in next sc; ch 1, sc in next 12 sc; turn. 
Decrease 1 st at neck edge on next 5 rows – 7 sts. Work 6 rows even in sc, end wrong side row.
Shape Tab-Next Row: Ch 2, (hdc, sc) all in first sc, sc in next 4 sc, decrease over last 2 sc; turn – 7 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat last 2 rows twice more – 7 sts.
Complete same as first tab.
Designed by Joan Barnett

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Light: 1 ball each of any two of the following: 3830 Pool, 3724 Pinkie, 3001 Frosting
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished Sole Length: 4 (4½, 5)” [10 (11.5, 12.5) cm]
gauge: 7 sts = 2” [5 cm]; 4 rounds = 2” [5 cm] in half double crochet (hdc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOOTIE (make 2)
With first color, ch 9 (11, 13).
Round 1 (right side): Work 2 hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 6 (8, 10) ch, 6 hdc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, hdc in next 6 (8, 10) ch, 2 hdc in next ch; join with slip st in first hdc—22 (26, 30) hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 7 (9, 11) sts, 2 hdc in next 6 sts, hdc in next 7 (9, 11) sts, 2 hdc in last st; join with slip st in first hdc—30 (34, 38) hdc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 4: With right side facing, join second color with slip st in same st as joining, repeat Round 3.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 9 (11, 13) sc, [hdc2tog] 6 times, sc in last 9 (11, 13) sc; join with slip st in first sc—24 (28, 32) sts.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 8 (10, 12) sts, [hdc2tog] 4 times, sc in next 8 (10, 12) sts; join with slip st in first sc—20 (24, 28) sts. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Set two booties side by side. Place a marker at center of inside edge of each bootie.
Strap and Trim: Join first color with slip st in marked st, ch 18 (20, 22) for strap, sc in same st and each st around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Sew a button to top edge of each bootie, opposite strap. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 886 Blue A, 311 White B, and 319 Cherry Red C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished Measurements: 28" (71cm) at widest point x 14" (35.5cm) at longest point
gauge: 10½ dc = 4" (10 cm); 6 rows = 4" (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BUNTING
With C, ch 4. 
Row 1: 5 dc in 4th ch from hook, (skipped 3 ch counts as first dc) – 6 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, dc in same st, 2 dc in each st across – 12 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st, dc in next st, [2 dc in next st, dc in next st] 5 times – 18 dc. 
Row 4: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st, dc in next 2 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts] 5 times – 24 dc. 
Row 5: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st, dc in next 3 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 3 sts] 5 times – 30 dc. 
Continue to increase 6 sts every row as established, working one more st in between each increase for 16 more rows. 
AT SAME TIME, when 8 rows of C have been completed, begin to work in stripe pattern as follows: 
Work 2 rows with B. 
Work 2 rows with C. 
Work 2 rows with B. 
Work 2 rows with C – 96 sts on last row worked. 
Rows 17-20: Change to A, ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across – 96 dc. 
Row 21: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Edging
Row 1: Turn piece to work along row edges, ch 1, work 80 sc evenly spaced along straight edge to first st of Row 21. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 9 sts, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in next sc, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across (tie made), sc in next 30 sc, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in next sc, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across (tie made), sc in 29 sts, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in next sc, ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across (tie made), sc in last 9 sts. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART 'Holiday': 1 Ball each 9040 Red/Silver A
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Garland measures 32½” long.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 7 rnds = 4” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GARLAND
Center: With A, ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring; ch 1, (sc, 4 hdc) all into ring, drop A, DO NOT FASTEN OFF; following the A sts, join B with an sc in the ring, work 4 hdc into same ring, drop B, DO NOT FASTEN OFF.
Rnd 1: Pick up A, work 2 hdc into each B st – 10 hdc A; drop A, pick up B, work 2 hdc in each A st – 30 hdc B, drop B.
Rnd 2: Pick up A, 2 dc in next 10 hdc, hdc in next hdc, * hdc in next hdc, sc in next hdc, slip st in next hdc, ch 5 *; fasten off A leaving a long end to sew loop; pick up B, 2 hdc in next hdc; repeat from * to * across next 3 hdc; fasten off B leaving a long end to sew loop.
Make 9 more pieces with your choice of A+C, B+C, or A+B.
CONNECTING GARLAND PIECES
First Piece: Thread yarn needle with long end left after ch-5 and stitch into coaster near beginning of the chain to make a loop; secure yarn on wrong side. Repeat on opposite side of coaster.
Join 2nd Piece: Thread yarn needle with long end left after ch-5 of 2nd piece, weave through a finished loop, stitch into coaster near beginning of this chain; secure yarn. Complete a loop on opposite side of coaster.
Continue until all pieces are joined. Additional pieces can be added to make garland longer if desired. 
JINGLE BELL FRINGE
Thread three bells onto A; ch 1, pull first bell up to first ch, make a ch over bell, continue to ch for total of 13”, pull 2nd bell up, ch 3, pull 3rd bell up, ch 2. Fasten off. Tie in bow around joining loops.
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Unforgettable™: 2 (3) balls 3955 Winery
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8] for Child size, 6mm [US J-10] for Adult size
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Neck (across top of one collar piece): 11 (13)” [28 (33) cm]; Finished Length: 15 (21)” [38 (53.5) cm]
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet for Child size. 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 12 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet for Adult size.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Dubonnet 
Poncho
Beautiful shaded yarn makes it easy to 
crochet this stunning poncho. The drapey 
style looks wonderful on all body types.
Cable Pattern 
Row 4 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 3, 
skip next 2 unworked sc of Row 3, sc in next sc, 
TURN and work sc in each ch of the ch-3 just 
made, slip st in the next sc (one cable made), 
TURN; working behind the cable, sc in each of 
the 2 skipped sc; repeat from * across to last 
sc, sc in last sc of Row 3, turn—16 cables.
Note: In the next row, you will work a sc in 
the first and last st, and 3 sc evenly spaced 
behind each cable. The 3 sc behind each 
cable are worked into the sc that were worked 
into the 2 skipped sc. Work sc in one of these 
skipped sc and 2 sc into the other. Push the 
cables towards the right side of the throw as 
you work. 
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc 
in next sc; repeat from * across to last sc, sc 
in last sc, turn—50 sc.
Front Ridge Pattern
Row 6 (right side): Repeat Row 2.
Row 7: Ch 1, working in free loops of sts of 
previous row, [sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 
4 times, sc in last 10 sc, turn—54 sc.
Arrow Pattern
Row 8 (right side): Ch 2 (does not count as a 
st), dc in first st, *skip next 3 sc, tr in next sc, 
working behind tr just made, dc in each of 3 
skipped sc; repeat from * across to last st, dc 
in last st, turn—13 repeats.
Row 9: Ch 2, dc in first dc, *skip next 3 dc, tr 
in next tr, working in front of tr just made, dc 
in each of 3 skipped dc; repeat from * across 
to last st, dc in last st, turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, [sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 4 times, sc in next 9 sc, sc in top of turning 
ch, turn—58 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, [2 sc in next  
sc, sc in next 15 sc] 3 times, sc in last 5 
sc—61 sc.
Directions for Child and Adult are worked 
the same using different size hooks. 
Measurements and information are given for 
Child size with changes for Adult size are in 
parentheses.   
Finished Neck (across top of one collar 
piece): 11 (13)” [28 (33) cm]
Finished Length: 15 (21)” [38 (53.5) cm]
Notes
1. Poncho is worked from neck edge
downwards.
2. Two collar pieces are worked first, back
and forth in rows. Buttonholes are worked
across the side edges of the front collar
before front and back collars are joined at
lower corners.
3. Lower portion of poncho is worked in joined
rounds beginning around lower edge of
collar.
FRONT COLLAR
Beginning at neck edge (top), ch 41.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 
ch, 2 sc in next ch, *sc in next 6 ch, 2 sc in 
next ch; repeat from * across to last 5 ch, sc 
in last 5 ch, turn—45 sc.
Front Ridge Pattern
Note: Both rows of the front ridge are worked 
into the sts of the same previous row. The first 
row (Row 2) is worked into the front loops 
only. The piece is turned and the next row 
(Row 3) is worked into the free loops of the 
same row (the free loops are in the front after

slip sts. 
Row 3: Ch 1, working in free loops of sts of 
previous row, [sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 
5 times, sc in last 5 sc, turn—50 sc.
in single crochet for Adult size.

Front Ridge Pattern
Row 12 (right side): Repeat Row 2.
Row 13: Ch 1, working in free loops of sts of 
previous row, [sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next 
sc] 4 times, sc in last 9 sc, turn—65 sc.
Cable Pattern
Rows 14 and 15: Repeat Rows 4 and 5—21 
cables.
Front Ridge Pattern
Row 16 (right side): Ch 1, working in front 
loops only, slip st in each sc across, turn
Row 17: Ch 1, working in free loops of sts  
of previous row, sc in each sc across, turn—
65 sc.
Buttonhole Plackets
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, working across 
side edge of front collar, work 17 sc evenly 
spaced across side edge, turn—17 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, ch 2, skip next 2 
sc (for buttonhole), sc in next 9 sc, ch 2, skip 
next 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn—13 sc and 2 
ch-2 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 
space, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 
sc in last 2 sc. Fasten off. Join yarn with 
slip st in corner of other side edge and work 
buttonhole placket in same manner.
BACK COLLAR
Work same as front collar through Row 17. 
Fasten off.
Sew lower corners of side edges of front and 
back collar together. Sew buttons to side 
edges of back collar opposite buttonholes on 
front collar.
LOWER PONCHO
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, 
join yarn with sc in side seam at lower edge of 
collar, *sc in next st (or end of row), ch 3, skip 
next st (or end of row); repeat from * around; 
join with slip st in first sc—68 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 3, dc) in first ch-3 space, 
ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, 2 dc in 
next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; 
repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in 
top of beginning ch.
Round 3: Slip st in next dc, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in 
next ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; 
repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in 
first sc.
Round 4: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space, 
ch 3, 2 dc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 dc in next ch-3 space; 
repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in 
first sc.
Round 5: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space, 
*ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from *
around, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 6: (Slip st, ch 3, 2 dc) in first ch-3
space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, 3
dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 7: Slip st in each dc to first ch-3 space,
(slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc
in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ch
3; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 8: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space,
ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in next
ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space;
repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in
top of beginning ch.
Rounds 9–11: Repeat Rounds 5–7.
Round 12: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3
space, ch 3, 4 dc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3,
sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 4 dc in next ch-3
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 13: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in next ch-3 
space, *ch 4, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat 
from * around, ch 4; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 14: (Slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) in first ch-4 
space, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 space, *ch 3, 4 
dc in next ch-4 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with 
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 15: Slip st in each dc to first ch-3 
space, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space, *ch 
4, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, 
ch 4; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 16: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-4 
space, ch 3, 4 dc in next ch-4 space, *ch 3, 
sc in next ch-4 space, ch 3, 4 dc in next ch-4 
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with 
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 17: Round 13.
Round 18: (Slip st, ch 3, 4 dc) in first ch-4 
space, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 space, *ch 3, 5 
dc in next ch-4 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with 
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 19: Round 15.
Round 20: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-4 
space, ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-4 space, *ch 3, 
sc in next ch-4 space, ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-4 
space; repeat from * around, ch 4; join with slip 
st in top of beginning ch.
Round 21: Repeat Round 13.
Rounds 22 and 23: Rounds 18 and 19. 
Note: For Child Size, skip to Last Round.
Adult Size Only: Repeat Rounds 20–23.
Last Round: Ch 1, *(4 dc, ch 3, slip st in top 
of dc last dc made (picot made), 4 dc) in next 
ch-4 space, sc in next ch-4 space; repeat 
from * around; join with slip st in first dc 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Each rectangle piece measures 12¼ x 27 (21¼ x 36)" (31 x 68.5 (54 x 91.4) cm). Finished Poncho measures 30 (40)" (76 (101.6) cm) across at widest point and 24¾ (34¾)” (63 (88) cm) in length when laid flat, not including neck or bottom edgings.
gauge: 16 sts (2 repeats) = 4.5" (11.5 cm) in Raised Chevron; 12 sts (1 repeat) = 3" (7.5 cm) in Loopy Stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FIRST RECTANGLE
RAISED CHEVRON PIECE
Ch 45 (77).
Row 1 (wrong side): Dc in the 3rd ch from hook (2 skipped sts do not count as a st), dc in each ch to the end, turn – 43 (75) dc. 
Row 2: Ch 2, dc in each of first 3 sts, *dc in next st, skip next st, fpdc around next dc, dc in top of same dc just used, fpdc around same dc again, skip next st, dc in each of next 4 sts; repeat from * to end, turn – 5 (9) pattern repeats.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc in each of first 3 sts, *skip next st, bpdc around next fpdc, dc in top of same fpdc just used, dc in next st, dc in top of next fpdc, bpdc around same fpdc just used, skip next st, dc each of next 3 sts; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 4: Ch 2, dc in each of first 2 sts, *skip next st, fpdc around next bpdc, dc in top of same bpdc just used, dc in each of next 3 dc, dc in top of next bpdc, fpdc around same bpdc just used, skip next st, dc in next st; repeat from * to last st, dc in last st, turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, dc in first st, skip next dc, bpdc around fpdc, dc in top of same fpdc just used, *dc in each of next 5 sts, dc in top of next fpdc, bpdc2tog over same fpdc just used and next fpdc skipping the center dc between the 2 fpdcs, dc in top of same fpdc just used, repeat from * to last 8 sts, dc in each of next 5 sts, dc in top of fpdc, bpdc around same fpdc just used, skip next st, dc in last st, turn.
Repeat rows 2 - 5 only until piece measures 26½ (35½)" (67.5 (90 cm) cm).
Last row: Ch 2, dc in each st to end. Fasten off.

SECOND RECTANGLE
LOOPY STITCH PIECE
Ch 49 (85).
Row 1 (setup row, wrong side): 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 3 ch, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice, * sc in each of next 3 ch, 2 sc in each of next 2 ch, sc in each of next 3 ch, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice; repeat from * to last 4 ch, sc in each of next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch, turn – 48 (84) sts, 4 (7) repeats.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc), dc in first st, dc in each of next 3 sts, [dc2tog over next 2 sts] twice * dc in each of next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st, ch 10, 2 dc in next st, dc in each of next 3 sts, [dc2tog over next 2 sts] twice; repeat from * to last 4 sts, dc in each of next 3 sts, 2 dc in last st, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each of next 3 st, sc2tog over next 2 sts, ch 10, sc2tog over next 2 sts, *sc in each of next 3 sts, 2 sc in each of next 2 sts, sc in each of next 3 st, sc2tog over next 2 sts, ch 10, sc2tog over next 2 sts; repeat from * to last 4 sts, sc in each of next 3 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn.
Repeat rows 2 and 3 only until piece measures 26 (35)" (66 (89) cm), ending with a Row 3.
Next row (right side): Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc), dc in first st, dc in each of next 3 sts, [dc2tog over next 2 sts] twice * dc in each of next 3 sts, 2 dc in each of next 2 sts, dc in each of next 3 sts, [dc2tog over next 2 sts] twice; repeat from * to last 4 sts, dc in each of next 3 sts, 2 dc in last st, turn.
Do not fasten off.
Make sure all loops show on RS. Just push through the fabric if need be to get all of them on the RS.
Braid first column of loops by pulling one loop through the next working from top of piece downward. Use a marker to temporarily hold down final loop. Braid second column working from the bottom upward. Continue alternating directions in this manner, working each column of loops in the direction of the corresponding chevron 'arrow'. So, braid upward for the chevron peaks, and downward for the chevron valleys.
Final row (wrong side): Ch 1, *sc in each of next 11 sts, tacking sc in next st; repeat from * to last 12 sts, sc in each of last 12 sts.
Fasten off.
Rotate piece 180 degrees. With right side facing, join yarn with a slip st at beginning of foundation row and work as follows:
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each of next 5 sts, tacking sc in next st, * sc in each of next 11 sts, tacking sc in next st; repeat from * to last 6 sts, sc in each of last 6 sts.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
With right sides up, match edges as shown in seaming diagram; pin to hold. (Designer suggests using mini knit clips.) Seam edges together with whip st.
Designer Note: once the pieces are pinned in place, take a look and see if the poncho is the right size for you. You could even try it on at this point and see if you wish to make some additions to make the piece a little larger and more custom fit for you.
Add some extra length to the panels by working more rows (caution: adding too much length to the panels will make your neckline too big and the poncho will fall off your shoulders) as follows: Raised Chevron Piece: undo the last double crochet row of stitching you completed then join your yarn on the last repeat row the Raised Chevron Panel and only work 1 more full row repeat. Then, work the double crochet row again and fasten off. 
Loopy st Piece: undo the final rows so that the loops are all free. Join your yarn to the last repeat row of the Loopy Chevron Panel and work as many 2 row repeats as necessary to match the new length of the Raised Chevron Panel. 
Then, rebraid where necessary, work the final rows again and fasten off. 
And/or: after the seaming is complete, add a couple extra rounds of half double crochet (round 2 of the edging instructions) before doing the final round of the edging to get a little extra around the body. Make Sure that you have the correct stitch multiple when indicated.

Bottom Edging
With right side facing, join yarn with a slip st in the first st to the left of a corner at bottom edge of Poncho.
Round 1: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), * work in hdc evenly to corner, 3 hdc in corner st and mark center st of 3 hdc just made; repeat from * once more, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2.
Be sure to end up with an even number of sts along each of the 2 edges, including corner sts.
Round 2: Ch 2, * hdc in each st to marked st, 3 hdc in marked st; repeat from * once more, hdc in last hdc, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2.
Fasten off.
Attach a fringe at every other stitch along bottom edge as follows:
Cut 3 strands of yarn, 12" (30.5 cm) each. Fold strands at center. Use hook to pull center of strands through edge st, then pull ends of strands through the resulting loop and pull tight.
Designer Note: If you decided to make your panels a bit longer, you may need to work a few extra sts on the first round of the neck edging. Try to add as few sts as possible without puckering the fabric or creating large gaps. Keep track of how many extra sts you added, then place that many markers at top edge, evenly spaced around the neck. On the second row, simply skip all the marked sts to get back to the correct number of sts needed.

Foldover Turtleneck
With right side facing, join yarn with slip st anywhere along neck edge.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), 108 dc evenly around neck edge, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 108 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, * bpdc around next st, fpdc around next st; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2.
Round 3 (decrease round): Ch 2, *[bpdc around next st, fpdc around next st] 7 times, bpdc around next st, fpdc2tog over next 2 fpdc skipping the bpdc between them; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 96 sts,
Rounds 4-6: Repeat Round 2.
Round 7 (decrease round) Ch 2, *[bpdc around next st, fpdc around next st] 6 times, bpdc around next st, fpdc2tog over next 2 fpdc skipping the bpdc between them; repeat from * 5 more times, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 84 sts.
Rounds 8-32: Repeat Round 2.
Fasten off.

instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds and rows does not count as hdc.
FACE
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: (RS) 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc.
10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 5 times more. 2 hdc in next hdc. Break A. Join B.
With B, *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
30 hdc.
Do not fasten off.
HAT
Note: Hat is worked in rows.
1st row: (WS). Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 9 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 3rd row once more. Fasten off.
BEARD
1st rnd: (RS). Join C with sl st to 1st unworked st of Face after Hat.
*2 dc in next st. 1 sl st in next st. Rep from * 9 more times. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With D and E, embroider Eyes, Mouth, and Hat Details as shown in picture.

instructions:
CROWN
Ch 60 (65, 70), being careful not to twist chain, join with slip st in first ch to form a circle. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc – 60 (65, 70) sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts a dc), dc in each of next 2 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 st, *dc in each of next 3 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 12 (13, 14) ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in next dc, *(2 hdc, dc, picot, dc, 2 hdc) in next ch-2 space**, skip next dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st in first sc – 12 (13, 14) shells. 
Round 4: Working sts loosely, *slip st in each st to next picot, skip next picot, working behind picot, slip st in next dc; repeat from * around, ending with slip st in each st to beginning; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.

instructions:
MUG HUG
Wrap
With A, ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across, ch 1; turn – 13 sc.
Rows 2 – 34: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, ch 1; turn. At end of Row 34, ch 10, slip st to last sc of Row 34 (button loop made). Fasten off.
Nose
With B and E hook, ch 5, slip st in second ch from hook, sc next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch. Fasten off.
Scarf
With D, ch 38.
Row 1: Hdc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across, ch 1; turn – 37 hdc.
Row 2: Hdc in each hdc across. Fasten off.
Tie
With D, ch 11. Row 1: Hdc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across, ch 1; turn – 10 hdc.
Row 2: Hdc in each hdc across. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Using photo as a guide, sew nose in place with B. With C, embroider French knots for mouth and satin st eyes. With D, sew scarf around bottom of wrap about ½” up. Gather middle and tie together and sew to scarf. Sew button in place on back of wrap. Weave in ends.

With B and 6mm [J-10] hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join with slip st in top of first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Cluster st, slip st in next 2 sc, cluster st in same st as last slip st made, slip st in next 2 sts, cluster st in same st as last slip st made, slip st in last sc, ch 6, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 4 chs, join with slip st to sc at base of ch-6. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.
FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, sew Shamrock onto front of Cozy. Weave in ends.
Special Stitches
Cluster st = Ch 3, *yarn over, insert hook in same st and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * 2 more times; yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook, ch 3, slip st in same st at base of cluster.
Special Technique
In order to get the rainbow effect, select a section of solid color on the skein and start in the middle of it.
COZY
With A and 5mm [H-8] hook, start in the middle of any solid color, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join with slip st in top of first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in sc, 2 sc in next sc], repeat around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc], repeat around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc], repeat around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 30 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in both loops of each sc around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 30 sc.
Rounds 8-19: Repeat Round 7. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Mushroom Medley Crochet and Cross Stitch Trivet
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Seabreeze (01201) 1 ball or 48 yds/44 m
Contrast A Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 6 ½" x 9 ¾" [16.5 x 25 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With MC, ch 22.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 
21 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until 34 rows total 
worked.
Fasten off.
With A and B, cross stitch 
Mushroom motif following Chart. 
Each square of chart equals 1 
single crochet.

materials: Crème de la Crème®: Brown Version: 1 ball each 118 Linen A and 930 Brownstone B
Blue Version: 1 skein each 870 Cornflower Blue A and 995 Ocean B
Pink Version: 1 skein each 710 Pale Pink A and 970 Pretty in Pink B
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Washcloth measures 7” x 7” (17.8 x 17.8 cm)
gauge: 19 sc and 11 rows = 4” (10 cmin dc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HANGING LOOP
With B, ch 10 and join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 25 sc in ring, join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a 6-8” (15-20 cm) sewing length.
BODY
Note: Work in back loop only throughout Body.
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A with a slip st in back loop of any sc, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), working in back loop only, dc in each of next 2 sc, 5 dc in next sc, dc in each of next 3 sc; turn – 11 dc. Place a marker in center st and move marker up as work progresses.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each dc across to marked st, 3 sc in marked center dc, sc in each dc across; turn – 13 sc.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in each sc across to marked st, 5 dc in marked center sc, dc in each sc across; turn – 17 dc.
Rows 4-20: Repeat Rows 2-3 (8 times); then repeat Row 2 once – 67 sc at end of last row.
STRIPING
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side facing and Hanging Loop on bottom, working in remaining loops of sts in Row 1 of Body, join B with a slip st in first dc, ch 1, sc in each dc across, loosely slip st in side of next sc row, turn – 11 sc.
Row 2 (right side): Working in remaining free loops of sts in same sc row of Body, sc in each st across, 2 slip st in side of next dc row, turn – 13 sc.
Row 3 (wrong side): Working in remaining free loops of sts in same dc row of Body, sc in each st across, slip st in side of next dc row, turn – 17 sc.
Rows 4-20: Repeat Rows 2-3 (8 times; then repeat Row 2 once – 67 sc at end of last row. Fasten off.
Row 21: With right side facing, join A with a slip st at base of first dc in Row 1 of Body, work 7 surface crochet slip sts evenly spaced across base of Row 1. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: LILY SUGAR'N CREAM STRIPES DISHCLOTH TO CROCHET OR KNIT
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Stripes (56.7 g / 2 oz) Crochet Version #21114 (Tie Dye Stripes) 1 ball
OR Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Stripes Super Size (70.9 g / 2.5 oz) Crochet Version #23114 (Tie Dye Stripes) 1 ball
OR Size 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: 10 ins [25.5 cm] square.
gauge: Crochet version 12 sc and 13 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
CROCHET VERSION
Ch 37. 
1st row:(RS). 
1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1.
Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep
from * to last ch. 1 sc in last ch.
36 sts. Turn.
2nd row:Ch 1. 
1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next
ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc
in last sc. Turn.
Rep last row for 10 ins [25.5 cm].
Fasten off.
KNIT VERSION
Cast on 37 sts.
Knit every row (garter st) for 
10 ins [25.5 cm]. Cast off knitwise.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each of 8001 Marshmallow A, 8215 Lemon B, 8506 Icepop C, and 8260 Orange D
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Scrubby measures 4½" (11.5 cm) in diameter.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SCRUBBY
Section (make 6: 3 with A and 1 each with B, C, & D)
Leaving a long beginning tail, ch 10. Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—9 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—7 sc. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Rows 4–7: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 twice—3 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, skip first st, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Disc
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 hdc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first hdc—6 hdc. Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as a guide for alternating arrangement of pieces. Holding right sides together and with beginning tails, whipstitch sections together. Sew disc to center of sections. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 530 Orchid A and 316 Soft White B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm), in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DRESS
Bodice
Round 1 (right side): With A, Fhdc 35 (38, 40, 45, 48); taking care not to twist sts, join with slip st in first Fhdc—35 (38, 40, 45, 48) sts. Note When completing round, work last stitch(es) in front of beginning chains and in skipped stitch before joining last stitch to first hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), skip next st, *hdc in next 6 (18, 19, 8, 23) sts, 2 (2, 1, 2, 2) hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—40 (40, 40, 50, 50) sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 3 (3, 3, 4, 4) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—50 (50, 50, 60, 60) sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 4 (4, 4, 5, 5) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—60 (60, 60, 70, 70) sts.
Round 5: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 5 (5, 5, 6, 6) sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—70 (70, 70, 80, 80) sts.
Directions are for size 3 months. Changes for sizes 6 months, 12 months, 18 months, and 24 months are in parentheses.
Special Stitches
dc3tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 3 times, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Fhdc (Foundation half double crochet (This technique creates a foundation chain and a row of half double crochet stitches in one) = Step 1: Place a slip knot on hook, ch 3, yarn over, insert hook in 3rd ch from hook and draw up a loop; yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the “chain”); yarn over and draw through 3 loops on hook (the “half double crochet”). Step 2: Yarn over, insert hook into the “chain” of the previous stitch and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through one loop on hook (the “chain”), yarn over and draw through 3 loops on hook (the “half double crochet”). Repeat step 2 for the length of foundation.
hdc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Dress is worked from the top down in 2 sections: bodice and skirt.
2. Bodice is worked in seamlessly joined rounds with right side facing at all times. One stitch is skipped at the beginning of each round and the last stitch(es) are worked into the skipped stitch before joining the round with a slip stitch.
See schematic and diagram on next page...
Size 3 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 8 sts, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 9 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—78 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 17 sts, ch 1, skip next 17 sts, hdc in next 22 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 17 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—44 sts and 2 ch.
Size 6 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 6 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—80 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 19 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—84 sts.
Round 8: Ch 2, skip next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 18 sts, ch 1, skip next 18 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 23 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 18 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—50 sts and 2 ch.
Size 12 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 6 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—80 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 9 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—88 sts.
Round 8: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 9: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 20 sts, ch 1, skip next 19 sts, hdc in next 25 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 19 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—50 sts and 2 ch.
Size 18 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 7 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—90 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 44 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—92 sts.
Rounds 8 and 9: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 10: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 21 sts, ch 1, skip next 20 sts, hdc in next 26 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 20 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—52 sts and 2 ch.
Size 24 months only:
Round 6: Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 7 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—90 sts.
Round 7: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 10 sts, *hdc in next 9 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first st—98 sts.
Rounds 8–10: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 11: Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in next 23 sts, ch 1, skip next 21 sts, hdc in next 28 sts (armhole made), ch 1, skip next 21 sts, hdc in last 5 sts (armhole made); join with slip st in first st—56 sts and 2 ch.
All sizes:
Round 8 (9, 10, 11, 12): Ch 2, skip next st, hdc in each st and ch; join with slip st in first st—46 (52, 52, 54, 58) sts.
Round 9 (10, 11, 12, 13): Ch 2, skip next st, *hdc in next 22 (25, 25, 26, 28) sts, 2 (2, 2, 1, 2) hdc in next st; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first st—48 (54, 54, 54, 60) sts.
Skirt
Round 10 (11, 12, 13, 14): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in same st as join, *dc in next st, dc3tog, dc in next st, 3 dc in next st; repeat from * to last 5 sts, dc in next st, dc3tog, dc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 (54, 54, 54, 60) sts.
Note The following rounds (except the last) begin with a slip st in center dc of first 3-dc group. The “last st” of each round is worked in the first dc of the first 3-dc group (same as the joining stitch of the previous round).
Round 11 (12, 13, 14, 15): Slip st in next st; change to B, ch 3, 2 dc in same st, *dc in next 2 sts, beginning in last st worked, dc3tog, dc in same st as last “leg” of dc3tog, dc in next st, 3 dc in next st; repeat from * to last 5 sts, dc in next 2 sts, beginning in last st worked, dc3tog, dc in same st as last “leg” of dc3tog, dc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—64 (72, 72, 72, 80) sts.
Round 12 (13, 14, 15, 16): Slip st in next st, ch 3, 2 dc in same st, *dc in next 3 sts, beginning in st just worked, dc3tog, dc in same st as last “leg” of dc3tog, dc in next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st; repeat from * to last 7 sts, dc in next 3 sts, beginning in st just worked, dc3tog, dc in same st as last “leg” of dc3tog, dc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—80 (90, 90, 90, 100) sts.
Round 13 (14, 15, 16, 17): Slip st in next st; change to A, ch 3, 2 dc in same st, *dc in next 3 sts, dc3tog, dc in next 3 sts, 3 dc in next st; repeat from * to last 9 sts, dc in next 3 sts, dc3tog, dc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 14 (15, 16, 17, 18)–21 (24, 25, 28, 30): Repeat Round 13 (14, 15, 16, 17) eight (ten, ten, twelve, thirteen) times and change color as in the following color sequence: Work 1 (1, 1, 1, 1) round with A, 2 (2, 2, 2, 2) rounds with B, 2 (2, 2, 2, 2) rounds with A, 2 (2, 2, 2, 2) rounds with B, 1 (2, 2, 2, 2) round(s) with A, 0 (1, 1, 2, 2) round(s) with B, 0 (0, 0, 1, 2) round(s) with A.
Do not change color.
Last Round: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, *sc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Neckline
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A with slip st in center st at back of Round 1, ch 1, sc in same st and in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—35 (38, 40, 45, 48) sts. Fasten off.
Sleeve Edging (work 2)
Notes Edging is worked in continuous rounds. Do not join at end of Round 1. Flatten dress so you can determine the center stitch of the underarm. You may want to place a stitch marker on this stitch.
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A with slip st in st at back of sleeve, ch 1, skip first st, hdc in each st to 2 sts before center st of underarm, hdc2tog, hdc in center st, hdc2tog, hdc in remaining sts, working last hdc in first skipped st—18 (19, 20, 21, 22).
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block if necessary.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each Teal 9518, Tangerine 4422 and Lavender 3720
Craft glue or hot glue gun
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Flower measures 2” (5.1 cm) diameter
gauge: GAUGE: Flower measures 2” (5.1 cm) diameter
instructions:
Add wrapped yarn letters to a shelf or wall in whatever name or words you desire! We’ve given you some hints here for covering the letters that can be purchased at many craft stores. For a feminine touch add the optional crocheted flowers.
1. Cover all surfaces of the letter by gluing an area and then wrapping yarn to cover it.
2. Glue your flowers in place as desired or to cover messiest areas.

FLOWERS 
(Make 2 flowers for each letter)
Ch 4, join with slip stitch to make a ring.
1st petal: *Sc into ring, ch 7.
Repeat from * 6 times – 7 petals.
Slip st into first sc.
Fasten off and weave in ends.

WRAP THE LETTERS
1. Cut short pieces of yarn and glue to ends of letters.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Loop = Insert hook into st. Wrap yarn around finger and pull up a loop. Keeping finger in place, yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook – Loop made.
measurements: Approx 5½ ins [14 cm] diameter.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Back
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
**2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.**
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc.
Fasten off.
Front
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
Work from ** to ** as given for Back, substituting Loop for each sc.
Note: Loops will be on WS of work.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 54 sc.
Fasten off.
Handle
With C, ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Join A with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join B with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join C with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join A with sl st to first sc.
Rep last 3 rnds until Handle measures 6 ins [15 cm].
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With RS of Front (flat side) and WS of Back facing, join C with sl st at edge. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc around to join. Fasten off. Sew Handle to Back as shown in picture.

materials: ⅓ yd [30 cm] of 45 ins [115 cm] wide fabric.
Size 3.25 mm (U.S. 3) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
5 ins [13 cm] of ¼ inch [6 mm] wide satin ribbon.
abbreviations: tension - swatch required to match yarn gauge
measurements: Length from top to heel = 20 ins [51 cm]. Foot length = 13 ins [33 cm].
gauge: 17 dc and 8 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 44 loosely.
Foundation row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 5. Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch) twice. *Miss next ch. 5 dc in next ch**. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. (Ch 5. Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch) 3 times. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. Turn.
1st row: Ch 3. 4 dc in first dc. *Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc**. (1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5) twice. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 4 dc in first sc. 1 sc in first ch-2 sp. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 5. (Miss next 2 dc, 1 sc and 2 dc). 1 sc in next dc**. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 5 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 4 dc in first dc. *Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc**. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Ch 2. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc**. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. (Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 5 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp**. (Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Ch 2. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 5**. (Miss next 2 dc, 1 sc and 2 dc). 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
7th row:*Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc**. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 3 dc in last sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *(Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice**. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Turn.
9th row: Miss first sc. *(Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice**. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 3 dc in last sc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch 5 sp**. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 5. (Miss next 2 dc, 1 sc and 2 dc). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Turn.
11th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc**. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once more. Ch 2. 1 dc in last sc.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc**. 1 sc in next dc. (Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
13th to 16th rows: As 5th to 8th rows.
17th row: Miss first sc. *(Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. Turn.
18th row: Ss in first 3 ch of ch 5. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp**. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 5. (Miss next 2 dc, 1 sc and 2 dc). 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Turn.
19th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc**. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. Turn.
20th row: Miss first sc. Sl st in each of next 3 dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *5 dc in next sc**. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. (Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
21st row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 2 dc in first sc. *Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc**. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. (Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 3 dc in last dc. Turn.
22nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 5. (Miss next 2 dc, 1 sc and 2 dc). 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * once more. Ch 5. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
23rd row: *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp**. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. Ch 2. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
24th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. *5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. (Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice**. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to ** once. Turn.
25th row: Miss first sc. *(Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * once more. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
26th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch 5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 5. (Miss next 2 dc, 1 sc and 2 dc). 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * once more. Ch 5. 1 sc in last ch 5 sp. Turn.
27th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. 3 dc in last sc. Turn.
28th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *5 dc in next sc**. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. (Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once more. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
29th row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 2 dc in first sc. *Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc**. 5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. (Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 3 dc in last sc. Turn.
30th to 45th rows: As 22nd to 29th rows twice.
46th to 51st rows: As 22nd to 27th rows.
52nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc**. 1 sc in next dc. (5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp) twice. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
53rd row: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 2 dc in first sc. *Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 3 dc in last sc. Turn.
54th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *5 dc in next sc. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Miss next 2 dc. 3 dc in top of ch 3.
55th row: As 53rd row. Fasten off. 
Place Stocking flat onto ironing board. Cover with a damp pressing cloth and apply a hot iron. Remove from ironing board when dry. 
Using Stocking as pattern for front and back, mark fabric according to shape allowing ¼ inch [6 mm] seam allowances. Cut front and back shapes out of fabric and sew outer edge seam. Fold under around top edge and sew in position. Sew Stocking to front. Attach ribbon loop.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays™ Cotton (80 g/2.8 oz; 126 m/138 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] tall (excluding hat).
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd.
Body: (make 2).
**With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
7 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around.
Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join. 28 sc
**
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join. 42 sc.
Fasten off.
Join Front and Back: With WS of Front and Back tog, join MC with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Miss next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 8 times. Fasten off.
Head: (make 2).
Work from ** to ** as given for Body.
Fasten off.
Overlap each piece of Head over opening of front and back of Body and sew in position, leaving front and back of Head open.
Scarf: With A, ch 38.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of A 3" [7.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe at each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.
Hat: With A, ch 21. Join with sl st to first chain to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 21 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made) 3 times. Join. 18 sts rem.
4th, 6th, 8th and 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 15 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 12 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 9 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 6 sts rem.
12th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 3 sts rem. Fasten off. Break yarn. Thread yarn through rem sts, pull tightly and fasten securely.
Nose: With A, ch 3. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew beads for eyes. Sew Nose in position. Secure center of Scarf at back of Body. Put on Hat to keep opening closed. Sew 3 buttons to front of Body for decorations.

materials: 1 skein each 312 Black A and 722 Pretty ‘N Pink B
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
measurements: Wristers measure 7 (9)” [18 (23) cm] circumference at knuckles.
gauge: 12 sts and 12 rows = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Top Edging
Row 1: Rotate to work along top of Wrister, work 22 (28) sc evenly across.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Bottom Edging 
Join A with slip st in first row end of bottom edge.
Rows 1-2: Repeat Rows 1-2 of Top Edging.
FINISHING
Using photo as a guide, align stitches of Row 1 with Row 21 (27). Sew row ends of top edging together, sew first 3 sts of Wrister, skip next 5 sts on Wrister (thumb hold made), sew remaining 9 (13) sts on Wrister, sew bottom edging row ends. Weave in ends.
Directions are for a teen. Changes for an adult are in parentheses.
NOTE
1. Wristers are worked in turned rows, then seamed leaving opening for thumb.
2. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Carry old color loosely up side of piece until next needed. 
WRISTERS (Make 2)
With A, ch 18 (22).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across – 17 (21) sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc Back Loop Only in each st across. 
Rows 3-4: Repeat Row 2, changing to B in last st of Row 4.
Rows 5-6: Repeat Row 2, changing to A in last st of Row 6. 
Rows 7-10: Repeat Row 2, changing to B in last st of Row 10.
Rows 11-16 (22): Repeat Rows 5-10, 1 (2) time(s). 
Rows 17-18 (23-24): Repeat Rows 5-6.
Rows 19-21 (25-27): Repeat Row 2.
Do not fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Fair Isle™: 1 skein 7259 Flamenco
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Wristers measure 8" (20.3 cm) in circumference and 8" (20.3 cm) long.
gauge: 14 sc = 4" (10 cm); 10 sc rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: redheart.com
©2018 Coats & Clark Page 1 of 2
Designed by Corina Gray
Special Stitch
3-HDC Popcorn = Work 3 half double crochet stitches in the same stitch, then drop the loop from your hook. Insert hook from front to back under the top 2 loops of the 1st half double crochet of the group. Grab the dropped loop with your hook and pull it through the stitch.

WRISTER (make 2)
Ch 24; slip st to 1st ch to form ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with slip st to 1st sc – 24 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st to 1st sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, hdc in 1st st, 3-hdc-popcorn in next st, *hdc in next st, 3-hdc-popcorn in next st; repeat from * 10 more times, join with slip st to 1st hdc – 24 sts.
Rounds 4-5: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st to 1st sc – 24 sc.
Rounds 6-7: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join with slip st to 1st hdc – 24 hdc.
Round 8: Ch 1, hdc in 1st st, ch 6, skip 2 sts, hdc in remaining 21 sts; join with slip st to 1st hdc – 28 sts.
Round 9: Ch 1, hdc in 1st st, hdc in each of 6 chs, hdc in remaining 21 sts; join with slip st to 1st hdc – 28 hdc.
Rounds 10-20: Ch 1, hdc in each hdc around; join with slip st to 1st hdc.
Rounds 21-22: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st to 1st sc – 28 sc.
Round 23: Ch 1, hdc in 1st st, 3-hdc-popcorn in next st, *hdc in next st, 3-hdc-popcorn in next st; repeat from * 12 more times, join with slip st to 1st hdc – 28 sts.
Rounds 24-25: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st to 1st sc – 28 sc.
Fasten off.

Thumb
Attach yarn to 1st skipped hdc from Round 8.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same hdc, sc in next skipped hdc, sc in corner hdc, sc in side of hdc from Round 8, sc in the top of same hdc (that you just crocheted into the side of), sc in bottom of next 6 ch, sc in side of next hdc from Round 8, sc in corner hdc; join with slip st to 1st sc – 13 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st to 1st sc.
Fasten off. Repeat on second Wrister. 

FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Fashion 3 (150 yds/147m) Atom Red (2160) 1 ball
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
For Beaded Scrunchie only: Sewing thread in contrasting color
24 size 6/0 or E glass Rochelle beads
abbreviations: PB (place bead) = Cut 12" [30.5 cm] length of sewing thread. Fold length in half and knot two ends tog making a larger than average knot. Drop crochet loop from hook, insert sewing needle through dropped loop and back through thread loop. Place bead on needle and draw crochet loop through bead. Pull on sewing thread knot and remove from crochet thread. Place dropped crochet loop back on hook.
Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
measurements: Scrunchie inside diameters measures same as elastic hairband.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project. Use recommended hook or hook size needed to make medium/tight stitches.
instructions:
Notes:
• Each Scrunchie is worked in joined rnds.
• 1st rnd is worked over top of elastic hairband using Covering-sc.

SCRUNCHIE #1 (Beaded Scrunchie)
See chart on page 3.
Make an adjustable ring.
1st rnd: Place slip knot on hook (1 loop on hook). Take working yarn over top of elastic hairband to back. Yoh and draw up a loop inserting hook from front to back through center of hairband (2 loops on hook). Yoh and draw through both loops on hook- covering-sc made. 2 covering-sc. Picot. (5 covering-sc. Picot) 11 times. 2 covering-sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 picot and 60 sc (12 groups of 5-sc).
2nd rnd: [Ch 6. PB. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 4. Skip next picot and 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc (3rd sc of 5-sc group). Skip next 2 sc] 12 times. 12 sc and 12 beaded petals.
3rd rnd: (Ch 8. PB. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 6. Sl st in next sc between petals) 12 times. Fasten off.

SCRUNCHIE #2 (Hearts over Hearts Scrunchie)
See chart on page 3.
1st rnd: Place slip knot on hook. 60 covering-sc over an elastic hairband. Join with sl st in first sc. 60 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 8 (counts as dc and ch 5). Skip first 5 sc. 1 dc in next sc. *Ch 5. Skip next 5 sc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Ch 5. Skip last 5 sc. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of beg ch-8. 10 dc and 10 ch-5 sps.
3rd rnd: Ch 9 (counts as tr and ch 5). 3-tr Cl in same sp as sl st. *Skip next ch-5 sp. (3-tr Cl. Ch 5. 3-tr Cl) in next dc. Rep from * to last ch-5 sp. Skip last ch-5 sp. 2-tr Cl in same sp as first 3-tr Cl. Join with sl st in 4th ch of beg ch-9. 10 cluster pairs (hearts).
4th rnd: * Ch 3. (3-dc Cl. Ch 3. 3-dc Cl) in 3rd ch of next ch-5. Ch 3. 1 sc in next sp between hearts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in base of beg ch-3. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit head circumference 18 (20-22)" [45.5 (51-56) cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Join rnds with sl st to top of first dcfp. 
With A, ch 56 (64-72). Join in rnd, taking care to not twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 (64-72) hdc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first hdc. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 hdc. 1 dcfp around next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 dcbp around each of last 3 hdc. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 3 sts. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 3 sts. Join.
Rep 3rd and 4th rnds for Waffle Pat until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm], ending on a 4th rnd. Join B. Break A.
With B, rep 3rd and 4th rnds for Waffle Pat until work from beg measures approx 5 (6-6 1/2)" [12.5 (15-16.5) cm], ending on a 4th rnd.
Shape top 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 hdc in next st. Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next st. Hdc2tog. Join. 42 (48-54) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of last 2 sts. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *Hdc2tog. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join. 28 (32-36) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *1 dcbp around next st. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last st. 1 dcbp around last st. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp around first dcfp. *Skip next st. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. Rep from * to last st. Skip last st. Join. 14 (16-18) sts.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st and in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 7 (8-9) times. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. 
Pompom: Wind A around 3 fingers 100 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape. Sew securely to top of Hat.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast A Neon Pink (39775) 1 ball or 30 yds/28 m
Contrast E Iris (39747) 1 ball or 80 yds/70 m
Caron® Simply Soft® Brites™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast B Super Duper Yellow (B9612) 1 ball or 30 yds/28 m
Contrast C Limelight (B9607) 1 ball or 30 yds/28 m
Contrast D Blue Mint (B9608) 1 ball or 30 yds/28 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit child to adult.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
MOTIFS
Make 1 each in the following color combinations:
Motif 1: E as Color 1, C as Color 2, A as Color 3.
Motif 2: D as Color 1, E as Color 2, C as Color 3.
Motif 3: A as Color 1, B as Color 2, E as Color 3.
Motif 4: C as Color 1, D as Color 2, A as Color 3.
Motif 5: E as Color 1, C as Color 2, B as Color 3.
Motif 6: B as Color 1, A as Color 2, D as Color 3.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. [(3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1] 3 times. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
Sew sides of 6 Motifs tog to form Ring in this order: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.
Hat Crown
Note: Join all rnds with sl st in first sc.
With RS facing, join E with sl st to any ch-2 sp at top edge of Ring of Motifs.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 78 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc. Fasten off. Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely.
Brim
Note: Join all rnds with sl st in first sc.
With RS facing, join E with sl st to any ch-2 sp at bottom edge of Ring of Motifs.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp around, working 1 sc in each corner ch-2 sp. Join. 78 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 84 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 90 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 96 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 102 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 108 sc.
7th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

abbreviations: sc2tog (sc dec) = Insert hook into st and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next st and draw up a loop. Yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
tr2tog = (Yo twice and insert the hook into the next st, yarn over, draw up a loop, yarn over, and draw through 2 of the loops on hook) twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Head Circumference: 20 (22)”
gauge: 13 sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 65 (73). 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 64 (72) sc.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 4 (counts as tr), *2 tr in next 3 (2) sc, tr in next sc; repeat from * to last 0 (3) sc, tr in last 0 (3) sc, turn – 112 (118) sts.
Rows 7-9: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 10: Ch 4 (counts as tr), tr in each sc across, turn.
Rows 11-12: Repeat Row 7.
Row 13: Sc2tog, *sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * to last 2 sts, sc2tog (sc in last 2 sts), turn – 92 (98) sts.
Row 14: Repeat Row 10.
Rows 15-16: Repeat Row 7.
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in next 4 (2) sc, *sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across, turn – 70 (74) sts.
Row 18: Repeat Row 10.
Rows 19-20: Repeat Row 7.
Row 21: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * to last 1 (2) sts, sc in last 1 (2) sts, turn – 47 (50) sts.
Row 22: Ch 4 (counts as tr), *tr2tog, tr in next st; repeat from * to last st, tr in last st, turn – 32 (34) sts.
Row 23: Repeat Row 7.
Row 24: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * to last 2 (1) sts, sc2tog (sc in last st), turn – 21 (23) sts.
Row 25: Repeat Row 7.
Row 26: Ch 1, [sc2tog] across to last st, sc in last st, turn – 11 (12) sts.
Row 27: Ch 1, sc in next 1 (0) st, [sc2tog] across, turn – 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
FINISHING
Weave tail through last sts and pull tight. Sew back seam closed. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Note: 1 ball will make approx 15 (10-9-6) Hats.
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Preemie 3-4 lbs (Preemie 5-6 lbs – Newborn 7-9 lbs -3 months 10-12 lbs). To fit head circumference: 81/2 (11-121/2 -14) [21.5 (28-32-35.5) cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size.
Note: Chain (Ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of round (rnd) does not count as stitch (st).
Beginning (Beg) at crown, chain (ch) 3. 
1st round (rnd): 8 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (Rep) from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
Size 3-4 lbs only: 4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
Sizes 5-6, 7-9 and 10-12 lbs only: 4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
Size 5-6 lbs only: 5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
Sizes 7-9 and 10-12 lbs only: 5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
Size 10-12 lbs only: 6th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 (36-40-50) hdc.
Rep last rnd until Hat measures approx 31/2 (4-41/2-5) [9 (10-11.5-12.5) cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Midnight®: 1 ball 1944 Harvest Moon
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [J-10 US]
Sewing needle and matching thread (optional for buttons)
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Headband measures 3” x 22” (7.5 x 56 cm), unbuttoned
gauge: 15 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Buttoned Crochet Headband
You don’t have to worry about the headband not being the right size…just place the buttons at your perfect comfort place! Crocheted in yarn with a bit of sparkle, you’ll love wearing this comfy headband.
Round 32: Ch 1, sc in in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 33: Sc2tog 3 times; join with slip st in first sc—3 sc.
Row 34: Sc3tog—1 sc. Do not fasten off.
Buttonhole Loop Row: Ch 12, working in back bars, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Second Side
With right side facing, join yarn with slip st to first ch of foundation ch.
Round 1: Working across opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Rounds 2–34 and Buttonhole Loop Row: Repeat Rounds 2–34 Buttonhole Loop Row of first side.
FINISHING HEADBAND
To form buttonhole loop, sew end of buttonhole loop row to Row 34 of first side. Repeat for second side.
CINCHING BAND
Ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd and last ch from hook, turn—2 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—8 sc.
Rows 11 and 12: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 13: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
