Rows 15 and 16: Repeat last 2 rows—4 sc.
Headband measures 3” x 22” (7.5 x 56 cm), unbuttoned.
Special Stitches
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop in next st] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Headband is worked in joined rounds with right side facing at all times.
2. Cinching band is worked in rows, wrapped around headband at midsection, and tacked in place.
3. Buttonholes cross at back of headband and loop over buttons. Buttons are worn at nape of neck.
HEADBAND
First Side
Ch 24; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first sc in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, working in back bars, sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2–22: Ch 1, sc in in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 23: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog twice, sc to last 5 sc, sc2tog twice, sc in last sc; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc in in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 25–30: Repeat last 2 rounds 3 times—8 sc.
Round 31: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
15 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
RED HEART® Boutique Midnight®, Art. E786, Available in 2.5 oz  (70 g), 153 yd (140 m) balls.
Designed by Nancy Anderson.
What you will need:
RED HEART® Boutique Midnight®: 1 ball 1944 Harvest Moon.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [J-10 US].
Yarn needle, stitch marker, two 11/8” (28.5 mm) wooden buttons, sewing needle and matching thread (optional for buttons).
GAUGE: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm);
Row 17: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next sc, sc2tog, turn—2 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Round 19: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, gather midsection of headband by weaving length of yarn in and out, pulling tightly, and securing. Wrap the cinching band around the gathered section and sew ends together; tack band in place to underside of headband. Center each button on top side 6” (15 cm) (or at desired distance) from end of each buttonhole loop and sew in place with strand of yarn or matching thread. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee Baby™ (140 g/5 oz; 331 m/362 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = (Draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit chest measurement 6 mos 17" [43 cm], 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm]; Finished chest 6 mos 18½" [47 cm], 12 mos 21" [53.5 cm]
gauge: 16 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Openwork Stripe Pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ).
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st, then draw a new color through rem 2 loops and proceed. Ch 2 does not count as hdc.
BODY (worked in one piece to armholes) 
With A, ch 74 (82). 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 73 (81) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join MC. Turn. 
3rd row: With MC, ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Rep from * across. Join A. Turn.
4th row: With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 sc in last hdc. Turn. 
5th to 7th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
Rep 2nd to 7th rows for Openwork Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 61⁄4" [16 cm], ending on a 4th row of pat.
Divide for armholes: Right Front: Next row: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 (19) sts. Join MC. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Cont even in pat for 7 (9) more rows, ending with RS facing for next row.
Shape neck: Next row: Sl st in each of first 3 (4) sts (neck edge). Ch 1 (2). Pat to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog or Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. Pat to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows once more. 10 (11) sts. Work 1 row even in pat. Fasten off.
BACK
With RS of work facing, miss next st, join appropriate color with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 36 (40) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 37 (41) sts.
Cont even in pat for 13 (15) more rows, ending with RS facing for next row. Fasten off.
LEFT FRONT
With RS of work facing, miss next sc, join appropriate color with sl st to next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 16 (18) sts. Turn.
Cont even in pat for 7 (9) more rows, ending with RS facing for next row.
Shape neck: Next row: Ch 1. Pat to last 3 (4) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Next row: Sc2tog or Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. Pat to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Pat to last 2 sts. Sc2tog or Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows once more. 10 (11) sts. Work 1 row even in pat. Fasten off.
SLEEVES 
With MC, ch 26 (30). 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 25 (29) sts. 
Beg on a 2nd row, work in Openwork Stripe Pat as given for Body, shaping sides by working 2 sts at beg and end of 7th and following 6th rows until there are 31 (35) sts, taking inc sts into pat.
Cont even in pat until Sleeve measures 6 (7½)" [15 (19) cm], ending with RS facing for next row. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Lower Edging: 1st row: With RS of Body facing, join MC with sl st in rem loop of foundation ch at corner of Left Front. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss next ch. [(1 dc. Ch 1) 3 times. 1 dc - shell made] all in next ch. *Miss next 3 ch. Shell in next ch. Rep from *across to last 2 ch. Miss next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *Shell in center ch-1 sp of next shell. Rep from * across. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1dc. Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook - picot made. 1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in center ch-1 sp of next shell. Rep from * across. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Fasten off.
Sew shoulder seams.
Collar: 1st row: With WS of Body facing, join MC with sl st at corner of Left Front neck edge. Work 36 (40) sc evenly around neck edge to opposite corner. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss next sc. Shell in next sc. *Miss next 3 sc. Shell in next sc. Rep from * across to last 2 sc. Miss next sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *Shell in center ch-1 sp of next shell. Rep from * across. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *(1 dc. Ch 1. 1dc. Picot. 1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) all in center ch-1 sp of next shell. Rep from * across. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Fasten off.
Buttonhole Band 1st row: With RS of Body facing, join MC with sl st at bottom corner of Right Front (excluding edging). Ch 1. Work 42 (46) sc evenly up Right Front to neck edge. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 (8) sc. Rep from * 3 times. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7(8) sc. Rep from * 3 times. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.
Button Band
Work as given for Buttonhole Band along Left Front edge, omitting all reference to buttonholes.
Sleeve Edging: 1st row: With RS of Sleeve facing, join MC with sl st in first loop of foundation ch. Ch 3 (counts as dc). Miss next ch. Shell in next ch. *Miss next 3 ch. Shell in next ch. Rep from * across to last 2 ch. Miss next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Fasten off.
Sew in sleeves. Sew side and sleeve seams. Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (Colors: 300 yds/274.32 m)
Size U.S. 9 [1.25 mm] Susan Bates® steel crochet hook
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Rose: Approx ¾" [2 cm] diameter, excluding earring wire. Cactus: Approx 1" [2.5 cm] tall, excluding earring wire.
gauge: Not specified
instructions:
Note: Cactus worked in continuous rnds top down.
Rose
See Diagram on page 2.
With B, ch 30.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 2. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep * to end of chain. Turn. 14 ch-2 sps.
2nd row: Ch 2. *(Sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc. Sl st) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * in each ch-2 sp to end of row. Leave last sc unworked. 14 petals. Fasten off, leaving long end.
Coil into a rose, having fasten off tail at center of Rose. Secure Rose with stitching through all thicknesses.
Cactus
See Diagram on page 2.
With A, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around.
4th to 11th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Stuff lightly.
12th rnd:  (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts. Fasten off leaving long tail. Weave tail through rem 6 sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Cactus Arms (Make 2)
See Diagram.
With A, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 6 sc. 
3rd rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around.
4th rnd: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stitch one arm on Left side of Cactus between rows 9 and 10. Stitch the second arm on Right side of Cactus between rnds 7 and 8. Stitch arms so that they sit against Cactus pointing up.
Top Flower 
See Diagram.
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: (Sl st. 1 dc) 6 times in 2nd ch from hook.
Fasten off with long tail for sewing. Stitch to top of Cactus at an angle.
FINISHING
Rose: Attach first jump ring to top of a petal at WS of Rose. Attach second jump ring to first jump ring. Attach third jump ring to second jump ring and to earring wire.
Cactus: Attach jump ring to top behind Flower. Attach second jump ring to first jump ring. Attach third jump ring to second jump ring and to earring wire.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 8 yards each 01 White and 12 Black
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 1.5mm [US-7 Steel Hook]
Sequins of various sizes & shapes in any desired colors
Small amount of fiber fill stuffing
measurements: Earrings measure 1¾” (4.5 cm) tall and 17⁄16” (3.5 cm) wide.
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 7⁄8” (2 cm). Gauge is not critical, fabric needs to be firm.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Day of the Dead 
Earrings
Whether you’re observing the Day of the Dead 
or Halloween, the skulls on these earrings 
add just the right touch. The findings for 
constructing the earrings are as close as your 
local craft store.

3 sc in next st, sc next 2 sts, sc2tog over next 
2 sts, sc next 3 sts, 2 sc next st, [sc in next 5 
sts, 2 sc in next st] 2 times; join with slip st in 
first sc – 50 sc and 2 sc2tog.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Embellish Skulls
Using photo as a guide, embroider mouths and 
noses on skulls with second color. To make 
eyes, sew sequins in place with one seed 
bead in center of each sequin with beading 
thread and needle to make eyes.
Using second color, sew 2 skulls Wrong Sides 
together with whipstitch around edges. Lightly 
stuff and sew jump ring firmly in place at top 
of skull. Use pliers to connect earring wires to 
jump ring.

EARRINGS
Skull (Make 2 in each color)
Round 1: Starting with first color, make an 
adjustable slip knot, ch 2, work 7 sc in 2nd 
ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc; pull 
beginning yarn tail to close center – 7 sc.

Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join 
with slip st in first sc – 14 sc.

Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 7 
times; join with slip st in first sc – 21 sc.

Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc – 28 sc.

Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 2 times, sc in next 4 sts, (sc, ch 1, dc) in 
next st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 
st, (dc, ch 1, sc) in next st, sc next 2 sts, 2 
sc next st, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 2 
times; join with slip st in first sc – 30 sc, 6 dc 
and 2 ch-1 spaces.

Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 2 times, sc next 3 sts, sc2tog over next 2 
sts, sc in ch-1, (sc, hdc, dc) in next st, dc in 
next 4 sts, (dc, hdc, sc) next st, sc next ch-1, 
sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc next 2 sts, 2 sc next 
st, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 2 times; 
join with slip st in first sc – 35 sc, 2 sc2tog, 2 
hdc and 6 dc.

Round 7: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 2 times, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog over next 2 
sts, sc next 2 sts, 3 sc next st, sc in next 4 sts.

pattern_name: Whale Of A Time Crochet Romper
materials: Bernat® Softee Baby™ (5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m)
Sizes U.S. C/2 (3.25 mm) and U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit chest measurement: 6 mos 17" [43 cm]; 12 mos 18" [45.5 cm]; 18 mos 19" [48.5 cm]
gauge: 16 hdc and 11.5 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• Romper is worked in one piece beginning at front neck and working down.
• Body section is worked in the round, turning at end of each round to maintain consistent texture with sections that are worked flat.
• Whale Applique is worked on smaller hook and sewn on during Finishing.

ROMPER
Front Bib: Beg at neck edge, with larger hook and B, ch 20 (20-24).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 (18-22) hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 2 (3-3) times more. 24 (26-28) hdc.
Next 2 (2-4) rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
1st rnd: Make Back and Join Front Bib: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Ch 40 (44-44) for Back. Join with sl st to first hdc to create rnd (taking care not to twist ch). Turn.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 40 (44-44) ch. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. 64 (70-72) hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 7 (6-5) hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 (6-5) hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join A with sl st to first hdc 2. 72 (80-84) hdc. Turn.
Proceed in Stripe Pat as follows, taking care to maintain color changes and carry unused color up WS of work:
Next 2 rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. Join B at end of 2nd rnd.
Next 2 rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. Join A at end of 2nd rnd.
Next 2 rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. Join B at end of 2nd rnd.
Rep last 4 rnds once more.
Next 2 rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. Join A at end of 2nd rnd. Break B.
Next rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. Rep last rnd until work from first rnd where Back chain is joined measures 6½ (7-8)" [16.5 (18-20.5) cm], ending on WS rnd. Fasten off.
Divide for crotch: Lay piece flat with Bib in center and place markers in last rnd on each side.
Back Panel: 1st row: (RS). Skip first 4 (5-5) hdc from side marker. Join A with sl st to next hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as join. 1 hdc in each of next 27 (29-31) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 3 (4-4) times more. 20 (20-22) sts.
Next row:  Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last row 3 times more. 12 (12-14) sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Back Panel section measures 6 (7-8)" [15 (18-20.5) cm]. Fasten off.
Front Panel: 1st row: (RS). Skip next 8 (10-10) hdc after Back Panel. Join A with sl st to next hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as join. 1 hdc in each of next 27 (29-31) hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 1 (2-2) time(s) more. 24 (24-26) sts.
Next row:  Ch 2. Hdc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Rep last row 5 times more. 12 (12-14) sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Front Panel section measures approx 4½ (5-6)" [11.5 (12.5-15) cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Cont as follows for Left Leg edging: (RS). Work 1 row of sc evenly along edge of Left Leg opening to bottom edge of Back Panel. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join A with sl st to opposite corner of Back Panel and work 1 row of sc evenly along edge of Right Leg opening to bottom edge of Front Panel. Fasten off.
Straps (make 2-worked lengthwise)
With A and larger hook,  ch 40 (44-48).
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 38 (42-46) hdc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off at end of 3rd row.
FINISHING
Sew ends of Straps in position to Back, positioning 3 (3½-3½)" [7.5 (9-9) cm] between Straps at center back. Cross Straps at back and sew 2 buttons on end of each Strap 1" [2.5 cm] apart, using space between sts on Front Bib for buttonholes. Sew 3 buttons evenly spaced along end of Back Panel. Use space between sts on Front Panel for buttonholes.
Whale Applique
Body: With A and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker on first sc. Do not join rnds.
2nd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 11 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 17 sc.
Make tail fin: Sl st in next sc. Ch 6. 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Ch 2. Sl st back into last ch. Ch 3. 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Ch 2. Sl st back into last ch.
Working along opposite side of rem ch, sl st in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Working into Body sts, 1 sc in same sp where last sl st of Body was worked. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st. Sl st in each of next 3 sts. Fasten off.
Stretch Applique slightly widthwise to lengthen and create whale shape.
With B, embroider eye using French knot and mouth using backstitch.
Sew Applique in position on Front Bib as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat ® Super Value (197 g/7 oz; 389 m/426 yds)
Quit Smoking Version Main Color (MC) (07391 White) 1 ball
Quit Swearing Version Main Color (MC) (00607 Berry) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Quit Smoking Version: Small amount of 07421 (Black) as B Glue.
Quit Swearing Version: Small amount of 07421 (Black) as B for embroidery.
measurements: To fit standard 1 quart [1 litre] canning jar.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
Cozy (both versions alike) 
With MC, ch 12. Join with sl st to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 24 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with B with sl st to first sc. 48 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from 7th rnd measures 7 ins [18 cm]. 
Fasten off. 
Quit Smoking Version: “No Smoking” Sign 
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with A with sl st to first sc. 64 sc. 
9th rnd: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. *1 dc in each of next 3 sc. 2 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 dc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Finishing
Quit Smoking Version 
Glue Cigarette to Sign. Cut 2 lengths of B to same height as Cigarette and glue to Sign as seen in picture. Cut 2 more lengths of B 1 inch [2.5 cm] and 2 ½ ins [6 cm] and glue to Sign in smoke format as seen in picture. Sew Strike Bar to Sign as seen in picture. 
Quit Swearing Version 
With black yarn, embroider symbols with outline stitch as in diagram.

materials: Medium Weight (#4) yarn of your choice
Contrast A White 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Contrast B Red 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Crochet a gauge swatch.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ornament is worked in continuous rnds, do not join at end of rnd.
• Move marker as work progresses in last st of each rnd.
• Ornament is worked with 2 colors simultaneously. Do not carry color at WS, pull long loop and drop loop on hook. Insert hook into loop of next color, pull working yarn to tighten and cont.
CANDY CANE
With A, make magic loop. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 6 sc in loop. PM on last st. Pull magic loop tight, do not join.
2nd rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Drop loop on hook, do not break A. Join B with sc in back loop of next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Drop loop on hook, do not break B.
3rd rnd: Working in back loops only, pick up A and work 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Drop loop on hook. Pick up B and work 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Drop loop on hook.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm].

Break A at end of last rnd. Do not break B.
Stuff Candy Cane lightly.
Note: To stuff, loosely roll polyfill into sausages and use back of crochet hook to push into place.
Last rnd: Pick up B. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, weave through tops of sts in last rnd and pull tight to close.

Assembly
Fold top 1" [2.5 cm] of Candy Cane down to form cane shape. With rem long tail, sew Candy Cane to itself to hold cane shape.

Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of A 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of Candy Cane, then pull Hanging Loop through itself and tighten to secure.

Alternate: With A and yarn needle, pass yarn through top of Candy Cane and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top of Candy Cane as possible and weave in ends.

Face
Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face near bottom of Candy Cane, as shown.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: To fit head circumference 6/12 mos 17" [43 cm], 18/24 mos 18" [45.5 cm]
gauge: 17 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Note: To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color. With MC, ch 72 (78). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 (78) sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures approx 1½" [4 cm]. Break MC. Join A. Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next 2 sc. 6 tr in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Skip next 2 sc. 6 tr in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Break A. Join MC. Next rnd: With MC, ch 1. Skip first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 tr. Ch 5. 1 sc in each of next 3 tr. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 254 Pumpkin A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Sizes: Pumpkin 2.25” x 2.75” (5.5 cm x 7 cm), Frankenstein 2.25” x 3” (5.5 cm x 7.5 cm), Bat 2.25” x 5” (5.5 cm x 12.5 cm)
gauge: 2 rounds hdc worked in pattern = 2.25” (5.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PUMPKIN
Round 1: (Right Side) With A, form a magic ring, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), work 9 hdc in ring; slip st in top of ch-2 to join—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as a st), 2 sc into each of next 2 sts, 2 dc into each of next 8 sts, slip st in top of ch-1 to join; fasten off—20 sts.
Pumpkin Stem
With C, leave a 6” (15 cm) tail, ch 6, hdc into second ch from hook, sc into next 4 sts; fasten off, leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail. Use tail ends to fasten Stem to Pumpkin, attaching sc portion on Round 2 with Right Side facing.
Pumpkin Face
Use fabric scissors to cut two triangle eyes and one jack-o-lantern mouth from the black felt. Referring to photograph for placement, arrange felt pieces. Using hot glue gun, carefully fasten each piece into place.
FRANKENSTEIN
Round 1: (Right Side) With C, form a magic ring, ch 2 (counts as first hdc now and throughout), work 9 hdc in ring; slip st in top of ch-2 to join—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st, 2 hdc in each st around; slip st in top of ch-2 to join; fasten off—20 hdc.
Frankenstein Hair
With Right Side facing, attach B in any st from Round 2, ch 2 (counts as first dc), dc in the next st, hdc in the next 4 sts, dc into the next st, ch 2 and slip st in the next st; fasten off—8 sts.
Frankenstein Bolt
With Right Side facing, attach D 2 sts below right side of Hair; ch 4, slip st into same space; fasten off. With Right Side facing, attach D 2 sts below left side of Hair; ch 4, slip st into same sp; fasten off.
Frankenstein Stitches
With Right Side facing, attach B and cut 12” (30.5 cm) of yarn. Referring to photograph for placement, use crochet hook or yarn needle to add Frankenstein stitches. Fasten off on Wrong Side.
Frankenstein Eyes
Use fabric scissors and hole punch to cut two flat-topped circles from the black felt. Referring to photograph for placement, arrange felt pieces. Using hot glue gun, carefully fasten each piece into place.
BAT
Round 1: (Right Side) With B, form a magic ring, ch 2 (counts as first hdc now and throughout), work 9 hdc in ring; slip st in top of ch-2 to join—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st, 2 hdc in each st around; slip st in top of ch-2 to join; fasten off—20 hdc.
Bat Wings (Make 2)
With B, leave a 6” (15 cm) tail; ch 7, turn.
Row 1: Skip 1 ch, sc2tog over next 2 ch, (hdc, picot, hdc) in the next ch, sc in the next ch, (hdc, picot, hdc) in the next ch, sc in the last ch; fasten off.
With Right Side facing and referring to photograph for placement, use end tail to fasten Left Wing to Round 2 of Bat. Flip Right Wing over so it mirrors Left Wing, skip 5 sts on the bottom, and fasten Right Wing to Bat.
Bat Teeth
With E, cut 24” (61 cm) of yarn. With Right Side of Bat facing and referring to photograph for placement, use crochet hook or yarn needle to add Teeth. Fasten off on Wrong Side.
FINISHING (all)
Use fabric scissors to cut out the following shapes from your black felt for each Trim:
• Backing: 2” (5 cm) circle
• Hanger: 1.25” (3 cm) long x ¾” (2 cm) wide rounded-top rectangle (use hole punch to cut a circle out of the rounded-top end)
Arrange Backing and Hanger, so that Hanger is between Backing and Trim, and punched hole is exposed on top. Using hot glue gun, carefully fasten Trim to felt pieces. Cut 15” (38 cm) of B and E. Hold together and knot evenly through punched hole. Use tails to tie onto gift bag.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m)
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Chiclet = (Yoh and draw up a loop to height of beginning ch) 4 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all 9 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] long, 1" [2.5 cm] wide
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes
• Leash is worked back and forth in rows, with one Chiclet worked in each row.
• After a long strip of Chiclets is complete, edging is worked all the way around the outer edge of strip.
• Clip is attached to Binky as 2nd edging round is worked.
BINKY LEASH
Version I
With A, ch 4.
1st row:  (RS). Chiclet in 4th ch from hook. Turn.
2nd to 22nd rows: Ch 3. Chiclet in ch-3 sp of previous row. Turn.
Do not fasten off. At end of last row.
Edging
Note: There is a “V” shaped space between Chiclets along the side edges of the strip of Chiclets. 1st rnd is worked into these “V” shaped spaces.

1st rnd: With A, working along first long side edge, *Ch 5. 1 sc in next sp between Chiclets. Rep from * along first side edge. Ch 14. Working along second long side edge, sl st in next sp between Chiclets, **Ch 5. 1 sc in next sp between Chiclets. Rep from ** along second side edge. Ch 5. Join B with sl st in base of ch-5. Break A.

2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 6 sc in each ch-5 sp and 18 sc in ch-14 sp all way around to last ch-5 sp. Hold base of clip tog with last ch-5 sp. 6 sc around base of Clip and ch-5 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Version II
Work as given for Version I, omitting all color references.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) 1 ball Main Color (MC) Black (0312) 256/234 360/329 yds/m
Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) Contrast A Silver Sea (2039) 3 4 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit hip measurement XS/S/M 32-42" [ 81.5-106.5 cm] L/XL/2XL 44-52" [ 112-132 cm] Finished hip measurement XS/S/M 37" [ 94 cm] L/XL/2XL 49" [ 124.5 cm]
gauge: Standard Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square. Modified Motif = Approx 5½" [14 cm] square. 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for size XS/S/M. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written XS/S/M (L/XL/2XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.

STANDARD MOTIF
Notes for Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™:
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. 
• If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends, leaving a tail for weaving in.
• Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
With A, make 42 ( 56) Standard Motifs.
***With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. ***
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 
Fasten off.

MODIFIED MOTIF
With A, make 6 Modified Motifs.
Work from *** to *** as given for Standard Motif.
4th rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
5th rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Crotch Gusset
Note: Each edge of Crotch Gusset should match length of side of Standard Motif.
With MC, ch 2. 
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc. 
4th to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
7th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
8th to 19th rows: Rep last 4 rows 3 times more. 12 sc. 
20th to 22nd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
23rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 10 sts. 
24th to 35th rows: Rep last 4 rows 3 times more. 4 sts. 
36th to 38th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
39th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 
40th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Turn. 
41st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
Following Assembly Diagrams on page 6, join Motifs using Flat Sl St seam as follows:
Top part of Pants: Make 2 strips with 6 ( 8) Standard Motifs in each strip, joining Motifs tog using Flat Sl St seam with MC. Join strips to make top part of Pants.
Join back seam.
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). With MC, sl st Motifs tog as shown in Assembly Diagram, working through back loops only, ensuring RS up on all Motifs, and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram).

Legs: [total 30 ( 40) Standard Motifs for both legs]. Make 10 strips (5 strips for each Leg) with 3 ( 4) Standard Motifs in each strip, joining Motifs tog using Flat Sl St seam. Join strips to make Legs, and to top part of Pants, leaving opening for crotch gusset.
Sew inner leg seams, and following diagram, sew Crotch Gusset in position between leg Motifs using Flat seam.
Leg edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join MC with sl st to inner leg seam. Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each dc, ch-1 and ch-3 sp around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Rep for second Leg.

Shape back Waistband: 1st rnd: Join MC with sl st to center back seam of pants. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st and each of next 45 (60) dc, skipping all ch-sps. 1 sc in center front joining seam. PM on last sc. 1 sc in each of next 45 (60) dc. Join with sl st to first sc. 92 (122) sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 6 ( 13) sc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 13 ( 20) sc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sc. 1 dc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 9 ( 16) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. 1 sc in each st to last 16 ( 23) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. 1 dc in each st to end of round. Join with sl st to first st.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 13 ( 20) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. 1 sc in each st to last 20 ( 27) sts. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. 1 dc in each st to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first st.
5th rnd: Ch 2 (doesn’t count as st). 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Waist Cord: First st: With MC, ch 2. Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook - chain made. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook - sc made. Remaining sts: *Draw up a loop in "chain" of previous st. Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook (chain). Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * until Cord measures length to fit waist measurement and extra length for tie. Fasten off.
Beg at front, thread cord through 5th rnd of hdc of Waistband. Tie both ends at front.

FRONT BIB
Make 2 strips with 2 Modified Motifs in each strip, joining Motifs tog using Flat Sl St seam with MC.
Join strips tog.

Front Bib Border
Note: Border is worked around sides and top of Front Bib. 
With RS facing, join MC with sl st to lower right corner of Front Bib.
1st row: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc, ch-1, and ch-3 sp (on either side of seam) along edge to next corner ch-3 sp. 3 sc in corner ch-3 sp. Ch 4. Skip next 4 sts. 1 sc in each dc, ch-1 and ch-3 sp (on either side of seam) to 4 sts before next corner ch-3 sp. Ch 4. Skip next 4 sc. 3 sc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each 1 sc in each dc, ch-1 and ch-3 sp (on either side of seam) to next corner ch-3 sp. 1 sc in corner ch-3 sp. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sc to 2 sts before next ch-4. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 4 sc in ch-4 sp. 1 sc in each sc to next ch-4 sp. 4 sc in ch-4 sp. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

BACK BIB
Join 2 Modified Motifs tog using Flat Sl St seam with MC. 
Note: Border is worked around sides and top of Back Bib. 
With RS facing, join MC with sl st to lower right corner of Back Bib. 
1st row: Ch 1. *Work 1 sc in each sc, ch-1, and ch-3 sp (on either side of seam) along edge to next corner ch-3 sp. 3 sc in corner ch-3 sp. PM on central sc of 3 sc. Rep from * twice more, ending final rep with 1 sc in corner ch-3 sp. Fasten off.  
Join Front Bib and Back Bib to Pants as shown in diagrams, being careful to align center of Bibs over center front and center back of Pants.

STRAPS (make 2)
With MC, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until Strap measures 11 (13)" [28 (33) cm]. Fasten off.
Join Straps to either side of Back Bib as shown in diagram on page 6. Sew buttons to opposite ends of Straps.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Main Color (MC) Sand (10014) 4 balls or 795 yds/727 m
Bernat® Blanket™ (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m) Contrast A Taupe (10029) 1 ball or 89 yds/81 m
Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m) Contrast B Go-Go Green (13004) 1 ball or 76 yds/70 m
Contrast C Race Car Red (13001) 1 ball or 59 yds/54 m
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] diameter.
gauge: 8 sc and 7 rnds = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook and 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
With larger hook and 2 strands of MC held tog, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
9th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
10th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
11th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sc.
12th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sc.
13th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
14th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 104 sc.
15th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 112 sc.
16th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
17th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 120 sc.
18th rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
19th to 21st rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
22nd rnd:  Join 2 strands of A held tog. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
23rd and 24th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
25th rnd:  With smaller hook, join 1 strand of B, working in front loops only, 2 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 240 sc. 
26th rnd:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in first sc. 3 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *3 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to stop of beg ch. Fasten off. 
27th rnd: With larger hook, join 2 strands of C held tog, working in back loops only from 24th rnd, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
28th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off. 
29th rnd:  Join 2 strands of MC held tog. Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 112 sc.
30th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 104 sc.
31st rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sc. 
32nd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sc.
33rd rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only , *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
Note: Begin stuffing bed as dec rnds are worked to ensure uniformity.
34th and alt rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
35th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sts.
37th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sts.
39th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sts.
41st rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
43rd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sts.
45th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
47th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
49th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
50th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sc. Fasten off.
Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket Sparkle™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Moonlight Sparkle (71001) or Rose Glow Sparkle (71002) 2 balls or 240 yds/219 m
Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Rosy Posey (04862) 2 balls or 240 yds/219 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 19" [48 cm] tall.
gauge: 9 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FRONT AND BACK (Make alike)
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Ch 2. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (1 sc. Ch 1) 5 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 5 sc and 5 ch-1 sps.
2nd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 1) twice in same ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1) twice in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc Rep from * around. Join. 10 sc and 10 ch-1 sps.
3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp as sl st. Skip next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
6th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
8th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
9th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
11th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join.
12th rnd: Sl st in next sc (2nd sc of rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. *1 sc in each of next 12 sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS of pieces facing each other, align edges of Front and Back. Join yarn with sl st at any ch-2 sp at point of star.
Joining rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc around, working 3 sc in each ch-2 corner sp and stopping to stuff Pillow before finishing round. Join. Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Cotton Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Half double crochet through back loop
Hdcfp = Half double crochet through front loop
Trfp = Treble crochet through front loop
measurements: Approx 12" x 16" [30.5 x 40 cm], excluding fringe
gauge: 15 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc. 
Front and Back (make alike)
Ch 68. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (RS). Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 5 ch. *1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. Sl st in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * to last ch. Sl st in last ch. Turn. 67 sts.
2nd and 3rd rows:  Ch 2. Working in back loops only , 1 hdc in each of first 6 sts. *Sl st in each of next 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 
4th and 5th rows:  Working in back loops only , sl st in each of first 6 sts. *1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Sl st in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last st. Sl st in last st. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures 5½" [14 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Next row:  (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first dc. 1 hdcfp around each dc to last dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn. 
Proceed in Lattice Pat as follows: 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of 2nd sc 2 rows below at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Skip next 3 sc 2 rows below. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of next sc 2 rows below at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – first trfp cluster made. *Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of last sc worked 2 rows below at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Skip next 3 sc 2 rows below. (Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop around post of next sc at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – trfp cluster made. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
5th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 trfp around first trfp cluster. *Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 trfp cluster over last trfp cluster and next trfp cluster. Rep from * to last 6 dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 trfp around last trfp cluster. Skip next dc. 1 sc in last dc. Turn.
6th row: As 2nd row.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. 1 trfp cluster over first trfp cluster and next trfp cluster. *Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 trfp cluster over last trfp cluster and next trfp cluster. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Turn. 
8th to 17th rows: Rep 4th to 7th rows twice more, then rep 4th and 5th rows once. 
18th row:  (WS). Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in front loops only, 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 
19th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first dc. 1 hdcbp around each dc to last dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn. 
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row:  (WS). Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each of first 6 sts. *Sl st in each of next 5 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Turn. 
2nd and 3rd rows:  Working in back loops only, sl st in each of first 6 sts. *1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Sl st in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last st. Sl st in last st. Turn.
4th row: As 1st row. 
Rep last 4 rows for pat until work from beg measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off. 
With WS facing of Front and Back tog, work 1 sc through both thicknesses across 3 sides, having 3 sc in each corner. Insert pillow form. Work sc across rem side to close. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off. 
Mini Tassels (make 24)
Wrap yarn around 3 fingers 25 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel ½" [1 cm] from tied end. Fasten securely. Attach Mini Tassels evenly spaced across dcbp rows on Front and Back as shown in photo.
Fringe
Cut strands of yarn 5" [12.5 cm] long. Taking 5 strands of random colors tog, fold in half and knot into fringe around entire Pillow. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Home Bundle™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 207 yds/189 m) - Morning Blue (14031) 3 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS) = Insert hook in next stitch. Wrap working yarn over top of index finger, from back to front, to form loop. Yoh and draw up a loop onto hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook, dropping loop off index finger to back of work (see diagram). Loop will be formed on RS of work.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] square.
gauge: 8 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FRONT
Note: Push tr sts worked on WS to RS of work to form bobbles. Ch 36. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 tr in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 

Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until piece from beg measures approx 17½" [44.5 cm] ending on a RS row. Turn. Do not fasten off. Beg working in rnds as follows: Loopy Edging: 1st rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Work Lp st evenly around 4 sides of Front, working 4 Lp st in each corner. Join with sl st to first Lp st. Do not Turn. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 Lp st in each st around. Join with sl st to first Lp st. Fasten off. 

BACK (make 2 pieces alike)
Ch 36. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep 2nd row until piece from beg measures approx 11" [28 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Beg working in rnds as follows: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around 4 sides of Back, working 4 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
Joining Front and Back: Overlap Back pieces to match Front to create center opening to insert pillow form. 1st rnd: Join yarn with sl st to any corner st. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® LusterSheen®: 1 ball each 0007 Vanilla A and 0915 Cherry Red B
Yarn needle, rust proof pins, starch if necessary
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Doily measures 8” (20 cm) in diameter
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 4” (10 cm) across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 8; join with slip st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in ring, ch 2, [3 dc in ring, ch 2] 5 times; join with slip st in top of ch-3.
Round 2: Ch 3, * fpdc around next dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, dc in ch-2 space, ch 1 **, dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 3: Beg cl over next 2 dc, * ch 2, skip next ch-1 sp, V st in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-1 sp **, cl over next 3 dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join in top of beg cl.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * ch 1, skip next ch-2 space, (3 tr, ch 2, 3 tr) in next ch-1 space, ch 1, skip next ch-2 space **, sc in next cl; repeat from * around, end at **; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 5: Join yarn in any ch-2 space; ch 4 (counts as tr), 8 tr in same space, ch 4, skip next 2 ch-1 spaces, [9 tr in next ch-2 space, ch 4, skip next 2 ch-1 spaces] 5 times; join in top of ch-4.
Round 6: Beg cl over next 2 tr, * [ch 3, cl over next 3 tr] twice, ch 4, dc in ch-4 space, ch 4 **, cl over next 3 tr (first 3 tr of next 9-tr group); repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 7: Skip Beg cl, [9 Tr in next cl, slip st in next cl, 4 sc in next ch-4 loop, sc in next dc, 4 sc in next ch-4 loop, slip st in next cl] 6 times, do not join.
Round 8: [Slip st in next 3 tr, skip next tr, (2 ddc, ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 1, 2 dc) in next tr, skip next tr, slip st in next 3 tr, skip next slip st, slip st in next 5 sc, ch 3, slip st in same sc as last slip st, slip st in next 4 sc, skip next slip st] 6 times; join in first slip st. Fasten off.
Finishing: Weave in ends. Mist well with water and pin to measurements, stretching to block. Allow to dry. OR if ends tend to curl, lightly spray starch on wrong side of doily.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 885 Delft Blue A and 320 Cornmeal B.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Placemat measures 13” x 19”, including fringe.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 14 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTES
Leave a 4” tail for fringe at beginning and end of each row.
To join at beginning of each row, make a slip knot and place on hook. Work first st as usual.
When working Adc on wrong side rows, insert hook in front loop of st 1 row below on back side of work (on right side).
Special Abbreviation
Anchored double crochet (Adc): insert hook in both loops of next st and draw up a loop, yo, insert hook in front loop of st 1 row below same st and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops on hook, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

PLACEMAT
With A, ch 59 loosely. Fasten off. Turn.

Row 1 (Right Side): Join A with sc in back bar of last ch made; sc in back bar of each remaining ch across – 59 sc. Fasten off.
Row 2: With wrong side facing, join B with sc in front loop of first st; sc in front loop of each remaining st across. Fasten off.
Row 3: With right side facing join A with Adc in first st made; sc in back loop of next st, Adc in next st; [sc in back loop of next 5 sts, Adc in next st, sc in back loop of next st, Adc in next st] 7 times – 16 Adc and 43 sc. Fasten off.
Row 4: With wrong side facing, join B with sc in front loop of first st, Adc in next st; [sc in front loop of next 7 sts, Adc in next st] 7 times; sc in front loop of last st – 8 Adc and 51 sc. Fasten off.
Row 5: With right side facing, join A with Adc in first st; [sc in back loop of next st, Adc in next st] 29 times – 30 Adc and 29 sc. Fasten off.
Row 6: With wrong side facing, join B with sc in front loop of first st, sc in front loop of next 4 sts; [Adc in next st, sc in front loop of next 7 sts] 6 times; Adc in next st, sc in front loop of last 5 sts – 7 Adc and 52 sc. Fasten off.
Row 7: With right side facing, join A with Adc in first st, sc in back loop of next 3 sts; [Adc in next st, sc in back loop of next st, Adc in next st, sc in back loop of next 5 sts] 6 times; Adc in last st – 16 Adc and 43 sc. Fasten off.
Row 8: Repeat Row 6.
Row 9: Repeat Row 5.
Row 10: Repeat Row 4.
Rows 11-42: Repeat Rows 3-10, 4 more times.
Rows 43-45: Repeat Rows 3-5.
Row 46: With right side facing, join A with slip st in back loop of first st, slip st in back loop of each remaining st across – 59 slip sts. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Matching row colors, add one strand of fringe to each side of placemat, inserting tails into fringe before tightening. Trim fringe to 1”, or to desired length.

materials: Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit Includes: 10 balls (1.7 oz/50 g each; 17.6 oz/500 g total), (61yds/ 56m each; 610 yds/560 m total)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small length of Red for Mouth.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 3½" [9 cm] tall (excluding Legs).
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd. Ch 3. See diagrams on page 2. 1st rnd: 8 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 2nd rnd: 2 hdc in each hdc around. 16 hdc. 3rd rnd: *2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 24 hdc. 4th rnd: *2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. 32 hdc. Make sides: 5th rnd: Working through back loop and horizontal bar at back of each st, 1 hdc in each hdc around. 6th rnd: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Rep last rnd until work from 5th rnd measures 3½" [9 cm]. Sl st in next hdc. Fasten off. Arms (Make 2) Ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 3rd rnd: 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 4th rnd: 1 sc in each st around. 5th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of 8th rnd. Legs (Make 2) Ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 4th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. 6 sts. 5th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off at end of last rnd. ‘Stuff’ feet with small amount of yarn. FINISHING Sew Arms to either side of Cozy. Sew Legs to front. Following manufacturer’s instructions, insert Safety eyes, approx 4 rows down from top edge, spaced 5 sc apart. With small length of Red, embroider mouth with straight stitch evenly between Eyes, 1 row below.

materials: Dual Duty XP Heavy Thread: 7450 Temple Gold
Dual Duty XP Heavy Thread: 8150 Spice
Dual Duty XP Heavy Thread: 900 Black
Dual Duty XP All Purpose Thread: 900 Black
Coats Metallic Thread: 440 Gold or 9450 Copper
measurements: 16” diameter
instructions: Cut one (1) 16 inch circle from black felt. Trace and cut out leaf patterns. Trace and cut out 3 acorn patterns. Arrange and pin paper patterns as desired at least 1 inch from circle edge. Thread machine with first color Dual Duty XP Heavy on top and black XP All Purpose thread in the bobbin. Using a zipper foot stitch around the leaf paper patterns using a 3.7 mm stitch length. Use a 3.1 mm stitch around the acorns. Remove paper pattern pieces. Pull threads to back and tie. Loosely stitch around the first thread outline with another shade of Dual Duty XP Heavy thread. Pull threads to back and tie. Thread top of machine with Coats Metallic thread for the final row of stitches. Pull to the back and tie. Press to remove any puckers or wrinkles. Place circle right side up on remaining felt. Pin and cut backing for candle mat. Finish the outer edge of the circle with a buttonhole stitch using black Dual Duty XP Heavy thread. Use the longest and widest settings on your machine. If your machine does not have a buttonhole stitch use a wide zigzag stitch.

materials: RED HEART® Strata™: Single Vanity Mat: 8 balls 2013 Aran. Double Vanity Mat: 17 balls 2013 Aran, Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½], Yarn needle, GAUGE: 14 sts and 12 rows in Mat pattern = 4” (10 cm), RED HEART® Strata™, Art E850 available in solid color 3.5 oz (100 g), 95 yd (86 m) balls
Bernat® Softee Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Fuchsia (69023)  1 ball or 125 yds/114 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops.
measurements: Approx 23" [58.5 cm] long x 3" [7.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 20 sts and 21 rows = 4" [10 cm] in sc/ch-1 (Moss st) pat.
instructions:
Ch 2. (See Diagram on page 2).
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 4 sts - 3 sc and 1 ch-1 sp.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sts – 4 sc and 1 ch-1 sp.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. 6 sts – 4 sc and 2 ch-1 sps.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sts – 5 sc and 2 ch-1 sps.
10th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sts – 5 sc and 3 ch-1 sps.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sts – 6 sc and 3 ch-1 sps.
14th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows twice more, inc 1 st at end of every RS row. 13 sts at end of last row. Place marker on last row on RS of work.
Work even in Moss St Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Moss St Pat until work from marked row measures 18" [45.5 cm], ending on a WS.
Beg Dec’s:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 3 times more to 5 sts, then rep 1st and 2nd rows once more. 4 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
Next row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 979 Mistletoe A, and 311 White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 4½ x 68" (11.5 x 172.5 cm)
gauge: 13 sts (including ch sts) = 4" (10 cm); 13 rows = 4"
instructions:
MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Sk 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.
SCARF
With A, ch through one full color sequence, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn. 
Row 1 (right side): Skip 3 ch (counts as a st), sc in the 4th ch from hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 1 full color sequence has been completed on this row. Count the number of sc made in each individual color in the colorway and note it down. Undo half the st repeats (sc, ch 1), rounded down, then undo one more repeat. Turn.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Note: As you work this row and all remaining rows, you MUST get the same number of sc in each color as you did in row 1 before pulling them out in order to maintain the planned color pooling. Each row will go through one half of a full color sequence, and so every 2 rows will go through one full color sequence. Change hook sizes, or actual st used, to get the correct color in place. If you use the same number of sts per color that you counted on Row 1 over the course of 2 rows, it will work out.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous right side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous wrong side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until scarf measures 68" (172.5 cm) or to desired length, ending on a Row 4 (wrong side row).
FINISHIING
Squish or stretch the sts on foundation chain to match the width of the rest of the Scarf. You can slide the sts around along the foundation chain, as with an adjustable ring. Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation.
Edging
With right side facing and working across foundation edge, join B with slip st in foundation ch st under last sc of Row 1.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc once more in same ch, * ch 1, sc in next space between sc of Row 1; repeat from * to ch-3 corner space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate Cowl to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, rotate Cowl to work along top edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space to corner ch-2 space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate Cowl to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, ch 1, join with sl st in beginning ch 2. Fasten off. 
Weave in all loose ends.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 16.5 cm [6½”] x 68.5 cm [27”].
gauge: cm [4”]; 16 rows = 10 cm [4”] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR TENSION/GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the tension/gauge.
instructions:
Ch 26.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Dc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 25 dc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, dc in first 3 dc, [ch 5, skip next 3 dc, dc in next 5 dc] twice, ch 5, skip next 3 dc, dc in last 3 dc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, dc in first 2 dc, [ch 3, dc in next ch-5 space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next 3 dc] twice, ch 3, dc in ch-5 space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in last 2 dc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, dc in first dc, [ch 3, dc in next ch-3 space, dc in next dc, dc in next space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 3 times; turn.
Row 5: Ch 5 (counts as tr and ch 2), dc in next space, dc in next 3 dc, dc in space, [ch 5, dc in next space, dc in next 3 dc, dc in next space] twice, ch 2, tr in last dc; turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, dc in tr, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next 3 dc, [ch 3, dc in next space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next 3 dc] twice, ch 3, dc in 3rd ch of ch-5; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, dc in first dc, dc in space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next dc, [ch 3, dc in next space, dc in next dc, dc in next space, ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next dc] twice, ch 3, dc in space, dc in last dc; turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, dc in first 2 dc, [dc in next space, ch 5, dc in next space, dc in next 3 dc] twice, d in next space, ch 5, dc in next space, dc in last 2 dc; turn.
Repeat Rows 3-8 eleven times more or to desired length.
Next Row: Ch 1, dc in each st across and work 3 dc in each ch-5 space; turn – 25 dc.
Edging
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, dc in each st across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, dc in first dc, * ch 3, skip next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * across. Fasten off.
With right side facing, attach yarn on opposite side and repeat Rows 1 and 2 of edging. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Sew on button to desired location, using ch-space as buttonhole.

materials: RED HEART® Baby TLC™: 2 (2, 2) balls 5960 Strawberry Orange OR 2 (2, 2) balls 5932 Baseball
Split-ring stitch markers, three 3/8” (9.5 mm) buttons, yarn needle
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: To Fit Chest: 15 (17, 18)”, [38 (43, 45.7) cm]; Finished Chest: 17 (18½, 20)”, [43 (47, 51) cm]; Finished Length: 9 (11, 12)”, [23 (28, 30.4) cm]; Finished Cap Circumference: 14 (16, 18)”, [35.5 (40.6, 45.7) cm]
gauge: 19 sts = 4”[10 cm]; 9 rows = 4” [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Twin Sweater Set
Almost too cute for words, this darling set 
of sweater and cap will keep your little one 
cozy. Crossed stitches make it interesting to 
crochet while adding a designer touch.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and 
throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each 
dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning 
ch—24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc 
in next dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 2 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—48 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 3 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 11 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 11 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—65 dc.
Directions are for size newborn. Changes 
for sizes 6 months and 12 months are in 
parentheses.
Sizes 6 months (12 months) Only
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 12 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 12 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—70 dc.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 13 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 13 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—75 dc.
Size 12 months Only
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 14 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 14 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—80 dc.
Round 10: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in 
next 15 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 15 dc; 
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of 
beginning ch—85 dc.
All Sizes
Next 4 Rounds: Ch 3, dc in each st around; 
join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Brim
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, beginning in same 
st as join, X-dc2, *X-dc3, X-dc2; repeat from 
* to last 2 dc, X-dc3; join with slip st in first
dc—13 (15, 17) X-dc.
Rounds 2–4: Ch 3, turn, *dc in 2nd dc of
next X-dc, ch 1, dc in first dc of same X-dc;
repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of
beginning ch.
Round 5 (Wrong Side): Do not turn, slip st
in next dc, (slip st, ch 1, sc, ch 3, dc) in next
ch-1 space, (sc, ch 3, dc) in each ch-1 space
around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off and weave in ends. Fold brim over.
SWEATER
Beginning at neck edge, ch 29.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook 
(beginning ch counts as first dc), 2 dc in next 
ch, dc in next 2 ch, 2 dc in each of next 2 ch, 
dc in next 14 ch, 2 dc in each of next 2 ch, dc 
in next 2 ch, 2 dc in each of last 2 ch—34 dc.
Note: In the next row, markers are placed to 
indicate four increase locations. In following 
rows, increases (2 dc) are worked in the 
stitches on each side of each increase location 
marker. The markers should be placed 
between the 2-dc groups and moved up as 
each row is worked. You may find it easiest to 
use a length of yarn as a marker and weave 
the length up between the 2-dc groups as you 
work each row.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and 
throughout), turn, dc in first dc, *2 dc in each 
of next 2 dc, place a marker between the two 
2-dc groups, dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in each of
next 2 dc, place a marker between the two
2-dc groups**, dc in next 16 dc; repeat from *
to ** once, 2 dc in top of beginning ch—44 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in first dc, *dc in each
dc to 1 dc before next marker, 2 dc in each of
next 2 dc; repeat from * 3 more times, dc in
each dc to turning ch, 2 dc in top of turning
ch—54 dc.
Shape Front Neck
Attach Front Neck Foundation Chain: Drop 
loop from hook and place loop on stitch marker 
or safety pin. With a separate length of yarn, 
join yarn with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 
of Row 3, ch 5 (for front neck ch). Fasten off. 
Return dropped loop (at end of Row 3) to hook.
Row 4: Ch 7, turn, dc in 4th ch from hook 
(skipped 3 ch count as first dc) and in next 3 
ch, *dc in each dc to 1 dc before next marker, 
2 dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * 3 
more times, dc in each dc to front neck ch, dc 
in each ch of front neck ch—72 dc.
Rows 5–10 (12, 14): Ch 3, turn, skip first dc, 
*dc in each dc to 1 dc before next marker, 2
dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * 3 more 
times, dc in each dc to turning ch, dc in top of 
turning ch—120 (136, 152) dc.
Attach Underarm Chains
Drop loop from hook and place loop on stitch 
marker or safety pin. With a separate length of 
yarn, join yarn with slip st in dc immediately 
before first marker, ch 4 (for underarm ch), 
skip all sts to 2nd marker (for armhole), slip 
st in dc immediately following 2nd marker. 
Fasten off. Repeat to attach an underarm ch 
between the 3rd and 4th markers.
